Job Title: Chief Financial Officer

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance, Management

Description:
Chief Financial Officer
The Role: 
We are currently recruiting an accomplished, entrepreneurial, and high-energy Chief Financial Officer with biotech and public company experience to join the leadership team. This person will report to the CEO and serve as a trusted business partner to the CEO, the leadership team, and the Board. 
The CFO will play a critical role in driving the future of the company as a highly visible strategic leader. He or she will have demonstrated success running a top-tier finance organization to execute the company’s mission and vision for long term growth, including successfully completing an IPO. 
Key Criteria 
Biotech industry experience Ability to be a leading voice in investor relations and communications to the BoardAbility to tell the Company’s story to investors, from the science to the finance Significant experience in the supervision, direction and motivation of professional and administrative personnel with the ability to roll up the sleeves when necessary Successful track record of originating and closing equity deals, with a strong existing networkSuccessfully took a company public – and is excited to do it again Experience engaging with a variety of funding sources including VC firms to raise additional equity rounds as necessary At least 20 years in increasingly senior finance positions including as CFO of a US publicly traded company and in a Private Equity Backed Company Experience in both IFRS and US GAAP Ability and willingness to travel international frequently Experience in working with the SEC and its Office of the Chief Accountant (or other departments) Experience in working with the TSX and CSA Experience in both Canadian and US public markets as CFO or similar position of a Reporting issuer Experience in scaling a finance organization from a small team to a large global team including people, process and systems Experience with International Transfer pricing Experience managing auditors in a PCAOB environment and managing international tax and valuation advisors Experience in Business Modelling and Corporate Performance Management including Balanced Scorecard or similar concept 

Responsibilities: 
As a business partner to the CEO and senior leadership team, the CFO will provide strategic insights into the organizational performance against the prior year’s performance, budgets and long-term strategy Prepares and leads IPO process including F1 filing Oversees long-term budgetary planning and cost management in alignment with the company’s strategic plans Advise the CEO on business development strategic planning Evaluates and implements financial systems, including user training, network, data security, risk, and contingency planning Coordinates and consolidates financial operations across the company’s global sites Ensures maintenance of appropriate internal controls and financial procedures Ensures IFRS/GAAP, legal and regulatory compliance regarding all financial functions Represents the company to business partners, analysts, investors, financial institutions and auditors Manages all short and long-term strategic financial objectives of the company, supporting the executive team with vital financial information and operational analytics and driving a culture of accountability in all aspects of the business Assists the CEO in the long-term growth of the company, including capital raising strategies 
Qualifications and Preferred Experience: 
A bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or business administration. MBA or PhD a plus Certified public accountant designation (CPA) preferred

Experience Level (if available): Executive
